Milošević et al.
28 performed ab initio calculations to study the electronic structure and optical properties of PVO (and BiCoO 3). Using first-principles density functional theory (DFT) calculations, Ming et al.
29 showed a first-order tetragonal-to-cubic phase transition with a volume collapse of 11.6% under a uniaxial pressure of 1.2 GPa accompanied by a C-AF insulator to an NM metal. Kadiri et al.
30 studied the magnetic properties of PVO using first-principles calculations and Monte Carlo simulations and determined PVO as an S = 1/2 antiferromagnet with a Néel temperature ( T N) of 182 K. Recently, Oka et al.
31 have examined the cubic phase of PVO under high pressure on experimental and theoretical bases. They determined the transition pressure to be 3 GPa and showed that above this pressure, the semiconductor-to-metal transition associated with the structural transition (tetragonal to cubic) occurs.
